reviews.text:
**Schema Update Note â€“ Spec v3 Migration**

Effective immediately, the schema for Spec v3 will adopt `snake_case` naming conventions for all field identifiers.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes an enforceable change in field naming conventions.

reviews.text: This update aligns with broader industry practices and improves consistency across internal systems.
reviews.reason_text: Explains alignment with industry practices without enforcing behavior.

reviews.text: All new fields added to Spec v3 will follow `snake_case` naming.
reviews.reason_text: Defines an enforceable field naming convention for new fields.

reviews.text: Existing fields using `camelCase` will remain available for a transitional period but are officially deprecated and will be removed by **2025-10-01**.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes a deprecation and removal constraint for existing fields.

reviews.text: To support downstream integration, a **transform** capability has been introduced within the aggregator layer.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes an enforceable transform capability in the aggregator layer.

reviews.text: This module will **dual-accept** both `snake_case` and `camelCase` keys for a period of **90 days** from today.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes an enforceable dual-accept capability for specific keys.

reviews.text: This grace period is intended to give clients and partners sufficient time to migrate their implementations without service disruption.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes a constraint on the grace period to avoid service disruption.

reviews.text: We strongly encourage teams to begin updating their systems to use `snake_case` exclusively.
reviews.reason_text: Provides encouragement but doesn't enforce action.

reviews.text: Updated documentation, including migration guides and revised sample payloads, is now available in the developer portal.
reviews.reason_text: Explains availability of documentation without enforcing behavior.

reviews.text: These resources include side-by-side examples for ease of transition and common pitfalls to avoid during implementation.
reviews.reason_text: Provides guidance but doesn't enforce behavior.

reviews.text: Please direct any technical inquiries or compatibility concerns to the integration support team.
reviews.reason_text: Instruction on contacting support without enforcing action.

reviews.text: Thank you for your cooperation in keeping our schema clean, predictable, and forward-compatible.
reviews.reason_text: Expresses gratitude but doesn't enforce behavior.
